citation.article-title: Neptuniibacter caesariensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel marine genome-sequenced gammaproteobacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Neptuniibacter (Nep.tu.ni.i.bac′ter. L. adj. Neptunius Neptunian, pertaining to Neptune, Roman god of the sea; N.L. masc. n. bacter a rod; N.L. masc. n. Neptuniibacter a Neptunian rod, referring to the habitat of the bacteria).
Slightly halophilic; no growth can be obtained without seawater or the addition of combined marine salts to the medium.
Preferred carbon sources are organic acids and amino acids.
Possess ubiquinone Q8 as a respiratory quinone.
DNA G+C content is around 47 mol%.
The genus is affiliated to the Class Gammaproteobacteria.
The type species is Neptuniibacter caesariensis.
